title: Trump Promises “Big League” Tax Cut Plan for Businesses, Stock Market Surges
text:

Any tax reform plan would first have to clear the Senate Finance Committee and House Ways and Means Committee, and though there are bound to be some disagreements on the details, Ways and Means chairman Kevin Brady said he was “pretty positive” that Congress and Trump were moving in the same direction. 
The U.K. Daily Mail noted that the announcement from Trump came just a day after prominent conservative media figure Matt Drudge had publicly chastised Republicans for not moving quickly on tax reform. 
As for Trump’s announcement of a “big league” reduction of the tax burden on businesses, it sent the stock market surging up 115 points to close at a new record high, with airline stocks spiking significantly in response to the promise of tax cuts and Trump’s talk of new infrastructure improvement projects in the airline industry. “We have an obsolete plane system, we have obsolete airports, we have obsolete trains, we have bad roads,” Trump lamented. “We’re gonna change all of that, folks. You’re gonna be so happy with Trump. I think you already are.” 
Investor’s Business Daily reported that Trump’s infrastructure talk also fueled a surge in the American steel sector of the market, with many leaders in the sector seeing their stock rise by as much as 4 to 8 percent. 
The American steel industry is expected to be one of the greatest beneficiaries of Trump’s tax and infrastructure plans, as well as his regulatory reform and trade policies that seek to provide more protection for American manufacturers competing against cheap foreign imports. 
Lower taxes for businesses and individuals would indeed be a “phenomenal” thing, and if those tax cuts prove to be as “big league” as has been promised, the market will likely surge to unprecedented heights as the economy strengthens and expands. Advertisement - story continues below
